notes.text:
The Migration Toolkit for Containers (MTC) 1.7.8 is now available.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The Migration Toolkit for Containers (MTC) enables you to migrate Kubernetes resources, persistent volume data, and internal container images between OpenShift Container Platform clusters, using the MTC web console or the Kubernetes API.

Security Fix(es):

* decode-uri-component: improper input validation resulting in DoS (CVE-2022-38900)

* gin: Unsanitized input in the default logger in github.com/gin-gonic/gin (CVE-2020-36567)

* express: "qs" prototype poisoning causes the hang of the node process (CVE-2022-24999)

* http-cache-semantics: Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) vulnerability (CVE-2022-25881)

* ua-parser-js: ReDoS vulnerability via the trim() function (CVE-2022-25927)

* loader-utils: Regular expression denial of service (CVE-2022-37603)

* json5: Prototype Pollution in JSON5 via Parse Method (CVE-2022-46175)

* jszip: directory traversal via a crafted ZIP archive (CVE-2022-48285)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es):

* The velero image cannot be overridden in the operator (BZ#2143389)

* Adding a MigCluster from UI fails when the domain name has characters more than 6 (BZ#2152149)

* UI fails to render the 'migrations' page: "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'name')" (BZ#2163485)

* Creating DPA resource fails on OCP 4.6 clusters (BZ#2173742)
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Migration Toolkit for Containers (MTC) 1.7.8 security and bug fix update

notes.text: A flaw was found in gin. This issue occurs when the default Formatter for the Logger middleware (LoggerConfig.Formatter), which is included in the Default engine, allows attackers to inject arbitrary log entries by manipulating the request path.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: gin: Unsanitized input in the default logger in github.com/gin-gonic/gin
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: gin: Unsanitized input in the default logger in github.com/gin-gonic/gin

cwe.name: Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

notes.text: A flaw was found in the express.js npm package of nodejs:14 module stream. Express.js Express is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by a prototype pollution flaw in qs. By adding or modifying properties of Object.prototype using a __proto__ or constructor payload, a remote attacker can cause a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: express: "qs" prototype poisoning causes the hang of the node process
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
- The qs and express Package is not used by the OpenShift Container Platform console directly and is only a third-party package dependency. Hence, it is marked as wontfix. 
As a result, any services that depend on Openshift for their use of qs and express are marked won't fix. 
- In OpenShift Service Mesh, 'qs' is hoisted from storybook and node-sass, both are dev dependencies, and the vulnerability is not exposed to end users. Hence marked as wontfix.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in http-cache-semantics. When the server reads the cache policy from the request using this library, a Regular Expression Denial of Service occurs, caused by malicious request header values sent to the server.

notes.text: A flaw was found in loader-utils webpack library. When the url variable from interpolateName is set, the prototype can be polluted. This issue could lead to a regular expression Denial of Service (ReDoS), affecting the availability of the affected component.

notes.text: A flaw was found in decode-uri-component. This issue occurs due to a specially crafted input, resulting in a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: decode-uri-component: improper input validation resulting in DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
For OpenShift Container Platform (OCP), Advanced Clusters Management for Kubernetes (ACM) and Advanced Cluster Security (ACS), the NPM decode-uri-component package is only present in source repositories as a development dependency, it is not used in production. Therefore this vulnerability is rated Low for OCP and ACS.

In Red Hat OpenShift Logging the openshift-logging/kibana6-rhel8 container bundles many nodejs packages as a build time dependencies, including the decode-uri-component package. 
The vulnerable code is not used, hence the impact to OpenShift Logging by this vulnerability is Low.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the json5 package. The affected version of the json5 package could allow an attacker to set arbitrary and unexpected keys on the object returned from JSON5.parse.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: json5: Prototype Pollution in JSON5 via Parse Method
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The json5 package is a build-time dependency in Red Hat products and is not used in production runtime. Hence, the impact is set to Moderate.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: A flaw was found in the JSZip package. Affected versions of JSZip could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system caused by the failure to sanitize filenames when files are loaded with `loadAsync`, which makes the library vulnerable to a Zip Slip attack. By extracting files from a specially crafted archive, an attacker could gain access to parts of the file system outside of the target folder, overwrite the executable files, and execute arbitrary commands on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jszip: directory traversal via a crafted ZIP archive
notes.title: Vulnerability summary
